snippet: One in four children has been physically abused, and one in five girls have been sexually abused, according to findings from a survey of 133 countries.
abstract: United Nations report states that homicide and acts of personal violence kill more people than wars and are third-leading cause of death among men aged 15 to 44; 475,000 homicide deaths occurred in 2012 around world.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: One in four children has been physically abused, and one in five girls have been sexually abused, according to findings from a survey of 133 countries.

headline.main: More People Die From Homicide Than in Wars, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: More People Die From Homicide Than in Wars, U.N. Says
